title: Logistics and Freight Forwarding Agreement - Israel Air at Ben Gurion Airport
summary: Israel Air engages Atlas Freight Israel Ltd. to provide domestic and international freight forwarding and customs brokerage at Ben Gurion Airport (TLV), including AOG (Aircraft on Ground) logistics, DG (dangerous goods) handling, bonded storage, and last-mile deliveries. The agreement covers comprehensive service SLAs, weight-based tariff pricing, and additional fees for AOG, security, and after-hours. The contract runs from Dec 1, 2024 to Oct 31, 2025, with weekly consolidated billing and 30-day payment terms. Termination for convenience requires 60 days’ notice; for cause, a 15-day cure period applies. Liability follows Montreal/Warsaw Convention; governing law is State of Israel.
commercial_terms: Pricing by weight breaks: 0–45 kg, 46–100 kg, 101–300 kg, 301–500 kg, >500 kg, per pre-agreed tariff. AOG (Aircraft on Ground) surcharge per attached matrix. Fuel surcharge indexed monthly to IATA Fuel Price Monitor, published first business day. After-hours/weekend surcharge: +18%. Security screening per piece at airport tariff. Weekly consolidated invoices. Payment terms: Net 30 days.
slas: 24×7 AOG hotline. Pickup within 120 minutes in Tel Aviv metro. Proof of delivery within 24 hours including recipient name, timestamp, and photo if available. EDI milestone tracking at key logistics stages. Staff certified for IATA DGR, with records retained for 24 months.
edge_cases: Demurrage/storage: First 24 hours free at Vendor facility, then per kg/day. Airport storage per IAA rate. Over-dimension/over-weight subject to feasibility and extra handling. Crating recommended for fragile items. Lost/damaged freight: liability as per Montreal/Warsaw Convention; declared value at premium. Deviations from standard Incoterms require written approval.
risk_liability: Liability is as per the Montreal/Warsaw Convention. Shipments can be insured for declared value at a premium. Staff maintains certifications for dangerous goods. Customs handled per arranged bonds. No explicit monetary caps stated for liability.
termination_law: Either party may terminate for convenience with 60 days’ notice, or for cause with a 15-day cure period. Governing law is the State of Israel. Standard survival and dispute resolution not further defined.
operational_baselines: Service location: Ben Gurion Airport (TLV). 24×7 AOG desk. Standard Incoterms: EXW, FCA, CPT, DAP. Shipments tracked via EDI at critical milestones. Collection, customs brokerage, storage, and last-mile to hangar/vendor premises handled. Staff DGR-certified. Weekly invoicing routines.
